When you're 28, science discovers a drug that stops all effects of aging, creating immortality. Your government decides to give the drug to all citizens under 26, but you and the rest of the "Lost Generations" are deemed too high-risk. When you're 85, the side effects are finally discovered.

But then the morning was "as usual" anymore.

When you're 28, science discovers a drug that stops all effects of aging, creating immortality. Your government decides to give the drug to all citizens under 26, but you and the rest of the "Lost Generations" are deemed too high-risk. When you're 85, the side effects are finally discovered.

To be honest, he was beginning to be okay with the fact that he would die someday - it wasn't the bitter disappointment is was almost 60 years ago. 

But then the morning was "as usual" anymore. 
Dan was watching the news when the anchorwoman, a young woman who had been with the station for about a year, suddenly froze.

But then the morning was "as usual" anymore. 
Dan was watching the news when the anchorwoman, a young woman who had been with the station for about a year, suddenly froze.
 She looked about 22, the age most people got the drug, though some got it as early as 16. She was frozen in place, her eyes wide and her mouth slightly open. Staring at the paper and then the telepromp

When you're 28, science discovers a drug that stops all effects of aging, creating immortality. Your government decides to give the drug to all citizens under 26, but you and the rest of the "Lost Generations" are deemed too high-risk. When you're 85, the side effects are finally discovered.

Dan woke up early that morning, as usual, had his cup of coffee, like usual, and sat down to watch the morning news, as usual. Everything was as it always was. To be honest, he was beginning to be okay with the fact that he would die someday - it wasn't the bitter disappointment is was almost 60 years ago. 

But then the morning was "as usual" anymore. 
Dan was watching the news when the anchorwoman, a young woman who had been with the station for about a year, suddenly froze.

Staring at the paper and then the teleprompter in front of her. She finally spoke, voice shaky, "I'm sorry, we have breaking news."  She looked about 22, the age most people got the drug, though some got it as early as 16. She was frozen in place, her eyes wide and her mouth slightly open. Staring at the paper and then the teleprompter in front of her. She finally spoke, voice shaky, "I'm sorry, we have breaking news." When you're 28, science discovers a drug that stops all effects of aging, creating immortality. Your government decides to give the drug to all citizens under 26, but you and the rest of the "Lost Generations" are deemed too high-risk. When you're 85, the side effects are finally discovered.

Dan woke up early that morning, as usual, had his cup of coffee, like usual, and sat down to watch the morning news, as usual. Everything was as it always was. To be honest, he was beginning to be okay with the fact that he would die someday - it wasn't the bitter disappointment is was almost 60 years ago. 

But then the morning was "as usual" anymore. 
Dan was watching the news when the anchorwoman, a young woman who had been with the station for about a year, suddenly froze.
 She looked about 22, the age most people got the drug, though some got it as early as 16. She was frozen in place, her eyes wide and her mouth slightly open. When you're 28, science discovers a drug that stops all effects of aging, creating immortality. Your government decides to give the drug to all citizens under 26, but you and the rest of the "Lost Generations" are deemed too high-risk. When you're 85, the side effects are finally discovered.

Dan woke up early that morning, as usual, had his cup of coffee, like usual, and sat down to watch the morning news, as usual. Everything was as it always was. To be honest, he was beginning to be okay with the fact that he would die someday - it wasn't the bitter disappointment is was almost 60 years ago. 

But then the morning was "as usual" anymore. 
Dan was watching the news when the anchorwoman, a young woman who had been with the station for about a year, suddenly froze.
 She looked about 22, the age most people got the drug, though some got it as early as 16. She was frozen in place, her eyes wide and her mouth slightly open. Staring at the paper and then the teleprompter in front of her. She finally spoke, voice shaky, "I'm sorry, we have breaking news." But then the morning was "as usual" anymore.

When you're 28, science discovers a drug that stops all effects of aging, creating immortality. Your government decides to give the drug to all citizens under 26, but you and the rest of the "Lost Generations" are deemed too high-risk. When you're 85, the side effects are finally discovered.

Dan woke up early that morning, as usual, had his cup of coffee, like usual, and sat down to watch the morning news, as usual. Everything was as it always was. To be honest, he was beginning to be okay with the fact that he would die someday - it wasn't the bitter disappointment is was almost 60 years ago. 

But then the morning was "as usual" anymore. 
Dan was watching the news when the anchorwoman, a young woman who had been with the station for about a year, suddenly froze.
 She looked about 22, the age most people got the drug, though some got it as early as 16. She was frozen in place, her eyes wide and her mouth slightly open. Staring at the paper and then the teleprompter in front of her. She finally spoke, voice shaky, "I'm sorry, we have breaking news." Within 24 hours they seemed to be comatose, though brain scans showed the same activity levels as a normal, conscious person. None have regain

Dan woke up early that morning, as usual, had his cup of coffee, like usual, and sat down to watch the morning news, as usual. Everything was as it always was. To be honest, he was beginning to be okay with the fact that he would die someday - it wasn't the bitter disappointment is was almost 60 years ago. 

But then the morning was "as usual" anymore. 
Dan was watching the news when the anchorwoman, a young woman who had been with the station for about a year, suddenly froze.
 She looked about 22, the age most people got the drug, though some got it as early as 16. She was frozen in place, her eyes wide and her mouth slightly open. Staring at the paper and then the teleprompter in front of her. She finally spoke, voice shaky, "I'm sorry, we have breaking news." Last month the earliest recipients of the drug 4EvR all reported to medical centers complaining of headaches. Within 6 hours they had lost their vision and hearing. Within 24 hours they seemed to be comatose, though brain scans showed the same activity levels as a normal, conscious person. THey remain in

When you're 28, science discovers a drug that stops all effects of aging, creating immortality. Your government decides to give the drug to all citizens under 26, but you and the rest of the "Lost Generations" are deemed too high-risk. When you're 85, the side effects are finally discovered.

Dan woke up early that morning, as usual, had his cup of coffee, like usual, and sat down to watch the morning news, as usual. Everything was as it always was. To be honest, he was beginning to be okay with the fact that he would die someday - it wasn't the bitter disappointment is was almost 60 years ago. 

But then the morning was "as usual" anymore. 
Dan was watching the news when the anchorwoman, a young woman who had been with the station for about a year, suddenly froze.
 She looked about 22, the age most people got the drug, though some got it as early as 16. She was frozen in place, her eyes wide and her mouth slightly open. Staring at the paper and then the teleprompter in front of her. She finally spoke, voice shaky, "I'm sorry, we have breaking news." Last month the earliest recipients of the drug 4EvR all reported to medical centers complaining of headaches. Within 6 hours they had lost their vision and hearing. Within 24 hours they seemed to be comatose, though brain scans showed the same activity levels as a normal, conscious person. They remain in that state."

Dan was watching the news when the anchorwoman, a young woman who had been with the station for about a year, suddenly froze.
 She looked about 22, the age most people got the drug, though some got it as early as 16. She was frozen in place, her eyes wide and her mouth slightly open. Staring at the paper and then the teleprompter in front of her. She finally spoke, voice shaky, "I'm sorry, we have breaking news." Last month the earliest recipients of the drug 4EvR all reported to medical centers complaining of headaches. Within 6 hours they had lost their vision and hearing. Within 24 hours they seemed to be comatose, though brain scans showed the same activity levels as a normal, conscious person. They remain in that state."

Dan stared at the screen in shock. THe

Dan was watching the news when the anchorwoman, a young woman who had been with the station for about a year, suddenly froze.
 She looked about 22, the age most people got the drug, though some got it as early as 16. She was frozen in place, her eyes wide and her mouth slightly open. Staring at the paper and then the teleprompter in front of her. She finally spoke, voice shaky, "I'm sorry, we have breaking news." Last month the earliest recipients of the drug 4EvR all reported to medical centers complaining of headaches. Within 6 hours they had lost their vision and hearing. Within 24 hours they seemed to be comatose, though brain scans showed the same activity levels as a normal, conscious person. They remain in that state."

Dan stared at the screen in shock. The newscaster continued.

When you're 28, science discovers a drug that stops all effects of aging, creating immortality. Your government decides to give the drug to all citizens under 26, but you and the rest of the "Lost Generations" are deemed too high-risk. When you're 85, the side effects are finally discovered.

When you're 28, science discovers a drug that stops all effects of aging, creating immortality. Your government decides to give the drug to all citizens under 26, but you and the rest of the "Lost Generations" are deemed too high-risk. When you're 85, the side effects are finally discovered.

Dan woke up early that morning, as usual, had his cup of coffee, like usual, and sat down to watch the morning news, as usual. Everything was as it always was. To be honest, he was beginning to be okay with the fact that he would die someday - it wasn't the bitter disappointment is was almost 60 years ago. 

But then the morning was "as usual" anymore. 
Dan was watching the news when the anchorwoman, a young woman who had been with the station for about a year, suddenly froze.
 She looked about 22, the age most people got the drug, though some got it as early as 16. She was frozen in place, her eyes wide and her mouth slightly open. Staring at the paper and then the teleprompter in front of her. She finally spoke, voice shaky, "I'm sorry, we have breaking news." Last month the earliest recipients of the drug 4EvR all reported to medical centers complaining of headaches. Within 6 hours they had lost their vision and hearing. Within 24 hours they seemed to be comatose, though brain scans showed the same activity levels as a normal, conscious person. They remain in that state."

To be honest, he was beginning to be okay with the fact that he would die someday - it wasn't the bitter disappointment is was almost 60 years ago. 

But then the morning was "as usual" anymore. 
Dan was watching the news when the anchorwoman, a young woman who had been with the station for about a year, suddenly froze.
 She looked about 22, the age most people got the drug, though some got it as early as 16. She was frozen in place, her eyes wide and her mouth slightly open. Staring at the paper and then the teleprompter in front of her. She finally spoke, voice shaky, "I'm sorry, we have breaking news." Last month the earliest recipients of the drug 4EvR all reported to medical centers complaining of headaches. Within 6 hours they had lost their vision and hearing. Within 24 hours they seemed to be comatose, though brain scans showed the same activity levels as a normal, conscious person. They remain in that state."

Dan stared at the screen in shock. The newscaster continued. "Scientists have been studying their condition and ha

When you're 28, science discovers a drug that stops all effects of aging, creating immortality. Your government decides to give the drug to all citizens under 26, but you and the rest of the "Lost Generations" are deemed too high-risk. When you're 85, the side effects are finally discovered.

Dan woke up early that morning, as usual, had his cup of coffee, like usual, and sat down to watch the morning news, as usual. Everything was as it always was. To be honest, he was beginning to be okay with the fact that he would die someday - it wasn't the bitter disappointment is was almost 60 years ago. 

But then the morning was "as usual" anymore. 
Dan was watching the news when the anchorwoman, a young woman who had been with the station for about a year, suddenly froze.
 She looked about 22, the age most people got the drug, though some got it as early as 16. She was frozen in place, her eyes wide and her mouth slightly open. Staring at the paper and then the teleprompter in front of her. She finally spoke, voice shaky, "I'm sorry, we have breaking news." Last month the earliest recipients of the drug 4EvR all reported to medical centers complaining of headaches. Within 6 hours they had lost their vision and hearing. Within 24 hours they seemed to be comatose, though brain scans showed the same activity levels as a normal, conscious person. They remain in that state."

 She looked about 22, the age most people got the drug, though some got it as early as 16. She was frozen in place, her eyes wide and her mouth slightly open. Staring at the paper and then the teleprompter in front of her. She finally spoke, voice shaky, "I'm sorry, we have breaking news." Last month the earliest recipients of the drug 4EvR all reported to medical centers complaining of headaches. Within 6 hours they had lost their vision and hearing. Within 24 hours they seemed to be comatose, though brain scans showed the same activity levels as a normal, conscious person. They remain in that state."

Dan stared at the screen in shock. The newscaster continued. "Scientists have been studying their condition and have come to the conclusion that it is due to the drug 4EvR

 She looked about 22, the age most people got the drug, though some got it as early as 16. She was frozen in place, her eyes wide and her mouth slightly open. Staring at the paper and then the teleprompter in front of her. She finally spoke, voice shaky, "I'm sorry, we have breaking news." Last month the earliest recipients of the drug 4EvR all reported to medical centers complaining of headaches. Within 6 hours they had lost their vision and hearing. Within 24 hours they seemed to be comatose, though brain scans showed the same activity levels as a normal, conscious person. They remain in that state."

Dan stared at the screen in shock. The newscaster continued. "Scientists have been studying their condition and have come to the conclusion that it is due to the drug 4EvR." She began to cry, "And a

When you're 28, science discovers a drug that stops all effects of aging, creating immortality. Your government decides to give the drug to all citizens under 26, but you and the rest of the "Lost Generations" are deemed too high-risk. When you're 85, the side effects are finally discovered.

To be honest, he was beginning to be okay with the fact that he would die someday - it wasn't the bitter disappointment is was almost 60 years ago. 

But then the morning was "as usual" anymore. 
Dan was watching the news when the anchorwoman, a young woman who had been with the station for about a year, suddenly froze.

Dan woke up early that morning, as usual, had his cup of coffee, like usual, and sat down to watch the morning news, as usual. Everything was as it always was. To be honest, he was beginning to be okay with the fact that he would die someday - it wasn't the bitter disappointment is was almost 60 years ago. 

But then the morning was "as usual" anymore. 
Dan was watching the news when the anchorwoman, a young woman who had been with the station for about a year, suddenly froze.
 She looked about 22, the age most people got the drug, though some got it as early as 16. She was frozen in place, her eyes wide and her mouth slightly open. Staring at the paper and then the teleprompter in front of her. She finally spoke, voice shaky, "I'm sorry, we have breaking news." Last month the earliest recipients of the drug 4EvR all reported to medical centers complaining of headaches. Within 6 hours they had lost their vision and hearing. Within 24 hours they seemed to be comatose, though brain scans showed the same activity levels as a normal, conscious person. They remain in that state."

Dan woke up early that morning, as usual, had his cup of coffee, like usual, and sat down to watch the morning news, as usual. Everything was as it always was. To be honest, he was beginning to be okay with the fact that he would die someday - it wasn't the bitter disappointment is was almost 60 years ago. 

But then the morning was "as usual" anymore. 
Dan was watching the news when the anchorwoman, a young woman who had been with the station for about a year, suddenly froze.
 She looked about 22, the age most people got the drug, though some got it as early as 16. She was frozen in place, her eyes wide and her mouth slightly open. Staring at the paper and then the teleprompter in front of her. She finally spoke, voice shaky, "I'm sorry, we have breaking news." Last month the earliest recipients of the drug 4EvR all reported to medical centers complaining of headaches. Within 6 hours they had lost their vision and hearing. Within 24 hours they seemed to be comatose, though brain scans showed the same activity levels as a normal, conscious person. They remain in that state."

Last month the earliest recipients of the drug 4EvR all reported to medical centers complaining of headaches. Within 6 hours they had lost their vision and hearing. Within 24 hours they seemed to be comatose, though brain scans showed the same activity levels as a normal, conscious person. They remain in that state."

When you're 28, science discovers a drug that stops all effects of aging, creating immortality. Your government decides to give the drug to all citizens under 26, but you and the rest of the "Lost Generations" are deemed too high-risk. When you're 85, the side effects are finally discovered.

Dan woke up early that morning, as usual, had his cup of coffee, like usual, and sat down to watch the morning news, as usual. Everything was as it always was. To be honest, he was beginning to be okay with the fact that he would die someday - it wasn't the bitter disappointment is was almost 60 years ago. 

But then the morning was "as usual" anymore. 
Dan was watching the news when the anchorwoman, a young woman who had been with the station for about a year, suddenly froze.
 She looked about 22, the age most people got the drug, though some got it as early as 16. She was frozen in place, her eyes wide and her mouth slightly open. Staring at the paper and then the teleprompter in front of her. She finally spoke, voice shaky, "I'm sorry, we have breaking news." Last month the earliest recipients of the drug 4EvR all reported to medical centers complaining of headaches. Within 6 hours they had lost their vision and hearing. Within 24 hours they seemed to be comatose, though brain scans showed the same activity levels as a normal, conscious person. They remain in that state."

Dan stared at the screen in shock. The newscaster continued. "Scientists have been studying their condition and have come to the conclusion that it is due to the drug 4EvR." She began to cry, "And according to their findings it is not only an inevitable side effect, but also one that is triggered or transmitted throu

But then the morning was "as usual" anymore. 
Dan was watching the news when the anchorwoman, a young woman who had been with the station for about a year, suddenly froze.
 She looked about 22, the age most people got the drug, though some got it as early as 16. She was frozen in place, her eyes wide and her mouth slightly open. Staring at the paper and then the teleprompter in front of her. She finally spoke, voice shaky, "I'm sorry, we have breaking news." Last month the earliest recipients of the drug 4EvR all reported to medical centers complaining of headaches. Within 6 hours they had lost their vision and hearing. Within 24 hours they seemed to be comatose, though brain scans showed the same activity levels as a normal, conscious person. They remain in that state."

Dan stared at the screen in shock. The newscaster continued. "Scientists have been studying their condition and have come to the conclusion that it is due to the drug 4EvR." She began to cry, "And according to their findings it is not only an inevitable side effect, but also one that is triggered or transmitted to users. In short

When you're 28, science discovers a drug that stops all effects of aging, creating immortality. Your government decides to give the drug to all citizens under 26, but you and the rest of the "Lost Generations" are deemed too high-risk. When you're 85, the side effects are finally discovered.

Staring at the paper and then the teleprompter in front of her. She finally spoke, voice shaky, "I'm sorry, we have breaking news." Last month the earliest recipients of the drug 4EvR all reported to medical centers complaining of headaches. Within 6 hours they had lost their vision and hearing. Within 24 hours they seemed to be comatose, though brain scans showed the same activity levels as a normal, conscious person. They remain in that state."

Dan stared at the screen in shock. The newscaster continued. "Scientists have been studying their condition and have come to the conclusion that it is due to the drug 4EvR." She began to cry, "And according to their findings it is not only an inevitable side effect, but also one that is triggered or transmitted to users. To summarize, al

When you're 28, science discovers a drug that stops all effects of aging, creating immortality. Your government decides to give the drug to all citizens under 26, but you and the rest of the "Lost Generations" are deemed too high-risk. When you're 85, the side effects are finally discovered.

Dan woke up early that morning, as usual, had his cup of coffee, like usual, and sat down to watch the morning news, as usual. Everything was as it always was. To be honest, he was beginning to be okay with the fact that he would die someday - it wasn't the bitter disappointment is was almost 60 years ago. 

But then the morning was "as usual" anymore.

Staring at the paper and then the teleprompter in front of her. She finally spoke, voice shaky, "I'm sorry, we have breaking news." Last month the earliest recipients of the drug 4EvR all reported to medical centers complaining of headaches. Within 6 hours they had lost their vision and hearing. Within 24 hours they seemed to be comatose, though brain scans showed the same activity levels as a normal, conscious person. They remain in that state."

Dan stared at the screen in shock. The newscaster continued. "Scientists have been studying their condition and have come to the conclusion that it is due to the drug 4EvR." She began to cry, "And according to their findings it is not only an inevitable side effect, but also one that is triggered or transmitted to users. To summarize, all people who have ever ta

When you're 28, science discovers a drug that stops all effects of aging, creating immortality. Your government decides to give the drug to all citizens under 26, but you and the rest of the "Lost Generations" are deemed too high-risk. When you're 85, the side effects are finally discovered.

Dan woke up early that morning, as usual, had his cup of coffee, like usual, and sat down to watch the morning news, as usual. Everything was as it always was. To be honest, he was beginning to be okay with the fact that he would die someday - it wasn't the bitter disappointment is was almost 60 years ago. 

But then the morning was "as usual" anymore.

Dan woke up early that morning, as usual, had his cup of coffee, like usual, and sat down to watch the morning news, as usual. Everything was as it always was. To be honest, he was beginning to be okay with the fact that he would die someday - it wasn't the bitter disappointment is was almost 60 years ago. 

But then the morning was "as usual" anymore. 
Dan was watching the news when the anchorwoman, a young woman who had been with the station for about a year, suddenly froze.
 She looked about 22, the age most people got the drug, though some got it as early as 16. She was frozen in place, her eyes wide and her mouth slightly open. Staring at the paper and then the teleprompter in front of her. She finally spoke, voice shaky, "I'm sorry, we have breaking news." Last month the earliest recipients of the drug 4EvR all reported to medical centers complaining of headaches. Within 6 hours they had lost their vision and hearing. Within 24 hours they seemed to be comatose, though brain scans showed the same activity levels as a normal, conscious person. They remain in that state."

Dan stared at the screen in shock. The newscaster continued. "Scientists have been studying their condition and have come to the conclusion that it is due to the drug 4EvR." She began to cry, "And according to their findings it is not only an inevitable side effect, but also one that is triggered or transmitted to users. To summarize, all people who have ever taken 4EvR will almost cer

Staring at the paper and then the teleprompter in front of her. She finally spoke, voice shaky, "I'm sorry, we have breaking news." Last month the earliest recipients of the drug 4EvR all reported to medical centers complaining of headaches. Within 6 hours they had lost their vision and hearing. Within 24 hours they seemed to be comatose, though brain scans showed the same activity levels as a normal, conscious person. They remain in that state."

Dan stared at the screen in shock. The newscaster continued. "Scientists have been studying their condition and have come to the conclusion that it is due to the drug 4EvR." She began to cry, "And according to their findings it is not only an inevitable side effect, but also one that is triggered or transmitted to users. To summarize, all people who have ever taken 4EvR will almost certainly have been expos

When you're 28, science discovers a drug that stops all effects of aging, creating immortality. Your government decides to give the drug to all citizens under 26, but you and the rest of the "Lost Generations" are deemed too high-risk. When you're 85, the side effects are finally discovered.

Dan stared at the screen in shock. The newscaster continued. "Scientists have been studying their condition and have come to the conclusion that it is due to the drug 4EvR." She began to cry, "And according to their findings it is not only an inevitable side effect, but also one that is triggered or transmitted to users, and the tranmis. When you're 28, science discovers a drug that stops all effects of aging, creating immortality. Your government decides to give the drug to all citizens under 26, but you and the rest of the "Lost Generations" are deemed too high-risk. When you're 85, the side effects are finally discovered.

Dan woke up early that morning, as usual, had his cup of coffee, like usual, and sat down to watch the morning news, as usual. Everything was as it always was. To be honest, he was beginning to be okay with the fact that he would die someday - it wasn't the bitter disappointment is was almost 60 years ago. 

But then the morning was "as usual" anymore. 
Dan was watching the news when the anchorwoman, a young woman who had been with the station for about a year, suddenly froze.
 She looked about 22, the age most people got the drug, though some got it as early as 16. She was frozen in place, her eyes wide and her mouth slightly open. Staring at the paper and then the teleprompter in front of her. She finally spoke, voice shaky, "I'm sorry, we have breaking news." Last month the earliest recipients of the drug 4EvR all reported to medical centers complaining of headaches. Within 6 hours they had lost their vision and hearing. Within 24 hours they seemed to be comatose, though brain scans showed the same activity levels as a normal, conscious person. They remain in that state."

Dan stared at the screen in shock. The newscaster continued. "Scientists have been studying their condition and have come to the conclusion that it is due to the drug 4EvR." She began to cry, "And according to their findings it is not only an inevitable side effect, but also one that is triggered or transmitted to users, . To summarize, all people who have ever taken 4EvR will almost certainly have been exposed

To be honest, he was beginning to be okay with the fact that he would die someday - it wasn't the bitter disappointment is was almost 60 years ago. 

But then the morning was "as usual" anymore. 
Dan was watching the news when the anchorwoman, a young woman who had been with the station for about a year, suddenly froze.
 She looked about 22, the age most people got the drug, though some got it as early as 16. She was frozen in place, her eyes wide and her mouth slightly open. Staring at the paper and then the teleprompter in front of her. She finally spoke, voice shaky, "I'm sorry, we have breaking news." Last month the earliest recipients of the drug 4EvR all reported to medical centers complaining of headaches. Within 6 hours they had lost their vision and hearing. Within 24 hours they seemed to be comatose, though brain scans showed the same activity levels as a normal, conscious person. They remain in that state."

Dan stared at the screen in shock. The newscaster continued. "Scientists have been studying their condition and have come to the conclusion that it is due to the drug 4EvR." She began to cry, "And according to their findings it is not only an inevitable side effect, but also one that is triggered or transmitted to users. To summarize, all people who have ever taken 4EvR will almost certainly have been exposed to others who have be

Dan woke up early that morning, as usual, had his cup of coffee, like usual, and sat down to watch the morning news, as usual. Everything was as it always was. To be honest, he was beginning to be okay with the fact that he would die someday - it wasn't the bitter disappointment is was almost 60 years ago. 

But then the morning was "as usual" anymore. 
Dan was watching the news when the anchorwoman, a young woman who had been with the station for about a year, suddenly froze.
 She looked about 22, the age most people got the drug, though some got it as early as 16. She was frozen in place, her eyes wide and her mouth slightly open. Staring at the paper and then the teleprompter in front of her. She finally spoke, voice shaky, "I'm sorry, we have breaking news." Last month the earliest recipients of the drug 4EvR all reported to medical centers complaining of headaches. Within 6 hours they had lost their vision and hearing. Within 24 hours they seemed to be comatose, though brain scans showed the same activity levels as a normal, conscious person. They remain in that state."

Dan stared at the screen in shock. The newscaster continued. "Scientists have been studying their condition and have come to the conclusion that it is due to the drug 4EvR." She began to cry, "And according to their findings it is not only an inevitable side effect, but also one that is triggered or transmitted to users. To summarize, all people who have ever taken 4EvR will almost certainly have been exposed to others who have been exposed to the o

When you're 28, science discovers a drug that stops all effects of aging, creating immortality. Your government decides to give the drug to all citizens under 26, but you and the rest of the "Lost Generations" are deemed too high-risk. When you're 85, the side effects are finally discovered.

Dan woke up early that morning, as usual, had his cup of coffee, like usual, and sat down to watch the morning news, as usual. Everything was as it always was. To be honest, he was beginning to be okay with the fact that he would die someday - it wasn't the bitter disappointment is was almost 60 years ago. 

But then the morning was "as usual" anymore. 
Dan was watching the news when the anchorwoman, a young woman who had been with the station for about a year, suddenly froze.
 She looked about 22, the age most people got the drug, though some got it as early as 16. She was frozen in place, her eyes wide and her mouth slightly open. Staring at the paper and then the teleprompter in front of her. She finally spoke, voice shaky, "I'm sorry, we have breaking news." Last month the earliest recipients of the drug 4EvR all reported to medical centers complaining of headaches. Within 6 hours they had lost their vision and hearing. Within 24 hours they seemed to be comatose, though brain scans showed the same activity levels as a normal, conscious person. They remain in that state."

Dan stared at the screen in shock. The newscaster continued. "Scientists have been studying their condition and have come to the conclusion that it is due to the drug 4EvR." She began to cry, "And according to their findings it is not only an inevitable side effect, but also one that is triggered or transmitted to users. To summarize, all people who have ever taken 4EvR will almost certainly have been exposed to others who have been exposed to the original group and we s

To be honest, he was beginning to be okay with the fact that he would die someday - it wasn't the bitter disappointment is was almost 60 years ago. 

But then the morning was "as usual" anymore. 
Dan was watching the news when the anchorwoman, a young woman who had been with the station for about a year, suddenly froze.
 She looked about 22, the age most people got the drug, though some got it as early as 16. She was frozen in place, her eyes wide and her mouth slightly open. Staring at the paper and then the teleprompter in front of her. She finally spoke, voice shaky, "I'm sorry, we have breaking news." Last month the earliest recipients of the drug 4EvR all reported to medical centers complaining of headaches. Within 6 hours they had lost their vision and hearing. Within 24 hours they seemed to be comatose, though brain scans showed the same activity levels as a normal, conscious person. They remain in that state."

Dan stared at the screen in shock. The newscaster continued. "Scientists have been studying their condition and have come to the conclusion that it is due to the drug 4EvR." She began to cry, "And according to their findings it is not only an inevitable side effect, but also one that is triggered or transmitted to users. To summarize, all people who have ever taken 4EvR will almost certainly have been exposed to others who have been exposed to the original group and we should all expect to experience the same

She began to cry, "And according to their findings it is not only an inevitable side effect, but also one that is triggered or transmitted to users. To summarize, all people who have ever taken 4EvR will almost certainly have been exposed to others who have been exposed to the original group and we should all expect to experience the same side effects within 2 weeks at the most."

When you're 28, science discovers a drug that stops all effects of aging, creating immortality. Your government decides to give the drug to all citizens under 26, but you and the rest of the "Lost Generations" are deemed too high-risk. When you're 85, the side effects are finally discovered.

Dan woke up early that morning, as usual, had his cup of coffee, like usual, and sat down to watch the morning news, as usual. Everything was as it always was. To be honest, he was beginning to be okay with the fact that he would die someday - it wasn't the bitter disappointment is was almost 60 years ago. 

But then the morning was "as usual" anymore. 
Dan was watching the news when the anchorwoman, a young woman who had been with the station for about a year, suddenly froze.
 She looked about 22, the age most people got the drug, though some got it as early as 16. She was frozen in place, her eyes wide and her mouth slightly open. Staring at the paper and then the teleprompter in front of her. She finally spoke, voice shaky, "I'm sorry, we have breaking news." Last month the earliest recipients of the drug 4EvR all reported to medical centers complaining of headaches. Within 6 hours they had lost their vision and hearing. Within 24 hours they seemed to be comatose, though brain scans showed the same activity levels as a normal, conscious person. They remain in that state."

Staring at the paper and then the teleprompter in front of her. She finally spoke, voice shaky, "I'm sorry, we have breaking news." Last month the earliest recipients of the drug 4EvR all reported to medical centers complaining of headaches. Within 6 hours they had lost their vision and hearing. Within 24 hours they seemed to be comatose, though brain scans showed the same activity levels as a normal, conscious person. They remain in that state."

Dan stared at the screen in shock. The newscaster continued. "Scientists have been studying their condition and have come to the conclusion that it is due to the drug 4EvR." She began to cry, "And according to their findings it is not only an inevitable side effect, but also one that is triggered or transmitted to users. To summarize, all people who have ever taken 4EvR will almost certainly have been exposed to others who have been exposed to the original group and we should all expect to experience the same side effects within 2 weeks at the most." 
Dan turned off the TV.
 HE was in

When you're 28, science discovers a drug that stops all effects of aging, creating immortality. Your government decides to give the drug to all citizens under 26, but you and the rest of the "Lost Generations" are deemed too high-risk. When you're 85, the side effects are finally discovered.

Dan woke up early that morning, as usual, had his cup of coffee, like usual, and sat down to watch the morning news, as usual. Everything was as it always was. To be honest, he was beginning to be okay with the fact that he would die someday - it wasn't the bitter disappointment is was almost 60 years ago. 

But then the morning was "as usual" anymore.

Dan woke up early that morning, as usual, had his cup of coffee, like usual, and sat down to watch the morning news, as usual. Everything was as it always was. To be honest, he was beginning to be okay with the fact that he would die someday - it wasn't the bitter disappointment is was almost 60 years ago. 

But then the morning was "as usual" anymore. 
Dan was watching the news when the anchorwoman, a young woman who had been with the station for about a year, suddenly froze.
 She looked about 22, the age most people got the drug, though some got it as early as 16. She was frozen in place, her eyes wide and her mouth slightly open. Staring at the paper and then the teleprompter in front of her. She finally spoke, voice shaky, "I'm sorry, we have breaking news." Last month the earliest recipients of the drug 4EvR all reported to medical centers complaining of headaches. Within 6 hours they had lost their vision and hearing. Within 24 hours they seemed to be comatose, though brain scans showed the same activity levels as a normal, conscious person. They remain in that state."

Dan stared at the screen in shock. The newscaster continued. "Scientists have been studying their condition and have come to the conclusion that it is due to the drug 4EvR." She began to cry, "And according to their findings it is not only an inevitable side effect, but also one that is triggered or transmitted to users. To summarize, all people who have ever taken 4EvR will almost certainly have been exposed to others who have been exposed to the original group and we should all expect to experience the same side effects within 2 weeks at the most." 
Dan turned off the TV.
 He was in shock.

Last month the earliest recipients of the drug 4EvR all reported to medical centers complaining of headaches. Within 6 hours they had lost their vision and hearing. Within 24 hours they seemed to be comatose, though brain scans showed the same activity levels as a normal, conscious person. They remain in that state."

Dan stared at the screen in shock. The newscaster continued. "Scientists have been studying their condition and have come to the conclusion that it is due to the drug 4EvR." She began to cry, "And according to their findings it is not only an inevitable side effect, but also one that is triggered or transmitted to users. To summarize, all people who have ever taken 4EvR will almost certainly have been exposed to others who have been exposed to the original group and we should all expect to experience the same side effects within 2 weeks at the most." 
Dan turned off the TV.
 He was in shock. He had never taken t

Dan woke up early that morning, as usual, had his cup of coffee, like usual, and sat down to watch the morning news, as usual. Everything was as it always was. To be honest, he was beginning to be okay with the fact that he would die someday - it wasn't the bitter disappointment is was almost 60 years ago. 

But then the morning was "as usual" anymore. 
Dan was watching the news when the anchorwoman, a young woman who had been with the station for about a year, suddenly froze.
 She looked about 22, the age most people got the drug, though some got it as early as 16. She was frozen in place, her eyes wide and her mouth slightly open. Staring at the paper and then the teleprompter in front of her. She finally spoke, voice shaky, "I'm sorry, we have breaking news." Last month the earliest recipients of the drug 4EvR all reported to medical centers complaining of headaches. Within 6 hours they had lost their vision and hearing. To summarize, all people who have ever taken 4EvR will almost certainly have been exposed to others who have been exposed to the original group and we should all expect to experience the same side effects within 2 weeks at the most." 
Dan turned off the TV.
 He was in shock. He had never taken the drug, but all of his younger realtives

When you're 28, science discovers a drug that stops all effects of aging, creating immortality. Your government decides to give the drug to all citizens under 26, but you and the rest of the "Lost Generations" are deemed too high-risk. When you're 85, the side effects are finally discovered.

Dan woke up early that morning, as usual, had his cup of coffee, like usual, and sat down to watch the morning news, as usual. Everything was as it always was. To be honest, he was beginning to be okay with the fact that he would die someday - it wasn't the bitter disappointment is was almost 60 years ago. 

But then the morning was "as usual" anymore. 
Dan was watching the news when the anchorwoman, a young woman who had been with the station for about a year, suddenly froze.
 She looked about 22, the age most people got the drug, though some got it as early as 16. She was frozen in place, her eyes wide and her mouth slightly open. Staring at the paper and then the teleprompter in front of her. She finally spoke, voice shaky, "I'm sorry, we have breaking news." Last month the earliest recipients of the drug 4EvR all reported to medical centers complaining of headaches. Within 6 hours they had lost their vision and hearing. Within 24 hours they seemed to be comatose, though brain scans showed the same activity levels as a normal, conscious person. They remain in that state."

Dan stared at the screen in shock. The newscaster continued. "Scientists have been studying their condition and have come to the conclusion that it is due to the drug 4EvR." She began to cry, "And according to their findings it is not only an inevitable side effect, but also one that is triggered or transmitted to users. To summarize, all people who have ever taken 4EvR will almost certainly have been exposed to others who have been exposed to the original group and we should all expect to experience the same side effects within 2 weeks at the most."

Last month the earliest recipients of the drug 4EvR all reported to medical centers complaining of headaches. Within 6 hours they had lost their vision and hearing. Within 24 hours they seemed to be comatose, though brain scans showed the same activity levels as a normal, conscious person. They remain in that state."

Dan stared at the screen in shock. The newscaster continued. "Scientists have been studying their condition and have come to the conclusion that it is due to the drug 4EvR." She began to cry, "And according to their findings it is not only an inevitable side effect, but also one that is triggered or transmitted to users. To summarize, all people who have ever taken 4EvR will almost certainly have been exposed to others who have been exposed to the original group and we should all expect to experience the same side effects within 2 weeks at the most." 
Dan turned off the TV.
 He was in shock. He had never taken the drug missing the age cut off by a me, but all of his younger realtives

Dan woke up early that morning, as usual, had his cup of coffee, like usual, and sat down to watch the morning news, as usual. Everything was as it always was. To be honest, he was beginning to be okay with the fact that he would die someday - it wasn't the bitter disappointment is was almost 60 years ago. 

But then the morning was "as usual" anymore. 
Dan was watching the news when the anchorwoman, a young woman who had been with the station for about a year, suddenly froze.
 She looked about 22, the age most people got the drug, though some got it as early as 16. She was frozen in place, her eyes wide and her mouth slightly open. Staring at the paper and then the teleprompter in front of her. She finally spoke, voice shaky, "I'm sorry, we have breaking news." Last month the earliest recipients of the drug 4EvR all reported to medical centers complaining of headaches. Within 6 hours they had lost their vision and hearing. Within 24 hours they seemed to be comatose, though brain scans showed the same activity levels as a normal, conscious person. They remain in that state."

Dan stared at the screen in shock. The newscaster continued. "Scientists have been studying their condition and have come to the conclusion that it is due to the drug 4EvR." She began to cry, "And according to their findings it is not only an inevitable side effect, but also one that is triggered or transmitted to users. To summarize, all people who have ever taken 4EvR will almost certainly have been exposed to others who have been exposed to the original group and we should all expect to experience the same side effects within 2 weeks at the most." 
Dan turned off the TV.
 He was in shock. He had never taken the drug missing the age cut off by a mere two years, but all of his younger realt

She began to cry, "And according to their findings it is not only an inevitable side effect, but also one that is triggered or transmitted to users. To summarize, all people who have ever taken 4EvR will almost certainly have been exposed to others who have been exposed to the original group and we should all expect to experience the same side effects within 2 weeks at the most." 
Dan turned off the TV.
 He was in shock. He had never taken the drug missing the age cut off by a mere two years, but all of his younger relatives had. His wife, his children, his grandchildren.

When you're 28, science discovers a drug that stops all effects of aging, creating immortality. Your government decides to give the drug to all citizens under 26, but you and the rest of the "Lost Generations" are deemed too high-risk. When you're 85, the side effects are finally discovered.

To be honest, he was beginning to be okay with the fact that he would die someday - it wasn't the bitter disappointment is was almost 60 years ago. 

But then the morning was "as usual" anymore.

When you're 28, science discovers a drug that stops all effects of aging, creating immortality. Your government decides to give the drug to all citizens under 26, but you and the rest of the "Lost Generations" are deemed too high-risk. When you're 85, the side effects are finally discovered.

Dan woke up early that morning, as usual, had his cup of coffee, like usual, and sat down to watch the morning news, as usual. Everything was as it always was. To be honest, he was beginning to be okay with the fact that he would die someday - it wasn't the bitter disappointment is was almost 60 years ago. 

But then the morning was "as usual" anymore. 
Dan was watching the news when the anchorwoman, a young woman who had been with the station for about a year, suddenly froze.
 She looked about 22, the age most people got the drug, though some got it as early as 16. She was frozen in place, her eyes wide and her mouth slightly open. Staring at the paper and then the teleprompter in front of her. She finally spoke, voice shaky, "I'm sorry, we have breaking news." Last month the earliest recipients of the drug 4EvR all reported to medical centers complaining of headaches. Within 6 hours they had lost their vision and hearing. Within 24 hours they seemed to be comatose, though brain scans showed the same activity levels as a normal, conscious person. They remain in that state."

Dan stared at the screen in shock. The newscaster continued. "Scientists have been studying their condition and have come to the conclusion that it is due to the drug 4EvR." She began to cry, "And according to their findings it is not only an inevitable side effect, but also one that is triggered or transmitted to users. To summarize, all people who have ever taken 4EvR will almost certainly have been exposed to others who have been exposed to the original group and we should all expect to experience the same side effects within 2 weeks at the most." 
Dan turned off the TV.
 He was in shock. He had never taken the drug missing the age cut off by a mere two years, but all of his younger relatives had. His children, his grandchildren, so many others. A

Dan was watching the news when the anchorwoman, a young woman who had been with the station for about a year, suddenly froze.
 She looked about 22, the age most people got the drug, though some got it as early as 16. She was frozen in place, her eyes wide and her mouth slightly open. Staring at the paper and then the teleprompter in front of her. She finally spoke, voice shaky, "I'm sorry, we have breaking news." Last month the earliest recipients of the drug 4EvR all reported to medical centers complaining of headaches. Within 6 hours they had lost their vision and hearing. Within 24 hours they seemed to be comatose, though brain scans showed the same activity levels as a normal, conscious person. They remain in that state."

Dan stared at the screen in shock. The newscaster continued. "Scientists have been studying their condition and have come to the conclusion that it is due to the drug 4EvR." She began to cry, "And according to their findings it is not only an inevitable side effect, but also one that is triggered or transmitted to users. To summarize, all people who have ever taken 4EvR will almost certainly have been exposed to others who have been exposed to the original group and we should all expect to experience the same side effects within 2 weeks at the most." 
Dan turned off the TV.
 He was in shock. He had never taken the drug missing the age cut off by a mere two years, but all of his younger relatives had. His children, his grandchildren, so many others. Ans soon they w

Last month the earliest recipients of the drug 4EvR all reported to medical centers complaining of headaches. Within 6 hours they had lost their vision and hearing. Within 24 hours they seemed to be comatose, though brain scans showed the same activity levels as a normal, conscious person. They remain in that state."

Dan stared at the screen in shock. The newscaster continued. "Scientists have been studying their condition and have come to the conclusion that it is due to the drug 4EvR." She began to cry, "And according to their findings it is not only an inevitable side effect, but also one that is triggered or transmitted to users. To summarize, all people who have ever taken 4EvR will almost certainly have been exposed to others who have been exposed to the original group and we should all expect to experience the same side effects within 2 weeks at the most." 
Dan turned off the TV.
 He was in shock. He had never taken the drug missing the age cut off by a mere two years, but all of his younger relatives had. His children, his grandchildren, so many others. Ans soon they would essentially b

Within 24 hours they seemed to be comatose, though brain scans showed the same activity levels as a normal, conscious person. They remain in that state."

Dan stared at the screen in shock. The newscaster continued. "Scientists have been studying their condition and have come to the conclusion that it is due to the drug 4EvR." She began to cry, "And according to their findings it is not only an inevitable side effect, but also one that is triggered or transmitted to users. To summarize, all people who have ever taken 4EvR will almost certainly have been exposed to others who have been exposed to the original group and we should all expect to experience the same side effects within 2 weeks at the most." 
Dan turned off the TV.

Last month the earliest recipients of the drug 4EvR all reported to medical centers complaining of headaches. Within 6 hours they had lost their vision and hearing. Within 24 hours they seemed to be comatose, though brain scans showed the same activity levels as a normal, conscious person. They remain in that state."

Dan stared at the screen in shock. The newscaster continued. "Scientists have been studying their condition and have come to the conclusion that it is due to the drug 4EvR." She began to cry, "And according to their findings it is not only an inevitable side effect, but also one that is triggered or transmitted to users. To summarize, all people who have ever taken 4EvR will almost certainly have been exposed to others who have been exposed to the original group and we should all expect to experience the same side effects within 2 weeks at the most." 
Dan turned off the TV.
 He was in shock. He had never taken the drug missing the age cut off by a mere two years, but all of his younger relatives had. His children, his grandchildren, so many others. Ans soon they would essentially be helpless with only a few aged people l

Dan was watching the news when the anchorwoman, a young woman who had been with the station for about a year, suddenly froze.
 She looked about 22, the age most people got the drug, though some got it as early as 16. She was frozen in place, her eyes wide and her mouth slightly open. Staring at the paper and then the teleprompter in front of her. She finally spoke, voice shaky, "I'm sorry, we have breaking news." Last month the earliest recipients of the drug 4EvR all reported to medical centers complaining of headaches. Within 6 hours they had lost their vision and hearing. Within 24 hours they seemed to be comatose, though brain scans showed the same activity levels as a normal, conscious person. They remain in that state."

Dan stared at the screen in shock. The newscaster continued. "Scientists have been studying their condition and have come to the conclusion that it is due to the drug 4EvR." She began to cry, "And according to their findings it is not only an inevitable side effect, but also one that is triggered or transmitted to users. To summarize, all people who have ever taken 4EvR will almost certainly have been exposed to others who have been exposed to the original group and we should all expect to experience the same side effects within 2 weeks at the most." 
Dan turned off the TV.
 He was in shock. He had never taken the drug missing the age cut off by a mere two years, but all of his younger relatives had. His children, his grandchildren, so many others. Ans soon they would essentially be helpless with only a few aged people like himself to ta

When you're 28, science discovers a drug that stops all effects of aging, creating immortality. Your government decides to give the drug to all citizens under 26, but you and the rest of the "Lost Generations" are deemed too high-risk. When you're 85, the side effects are finally discovered.

Dan woke up early that morning, as usual, had his cup of coffee, like usual, and sat down to watch the morning news, as usual. Everything was as it always was. To be honest, he was beginning to be okay with the fact that he would die someday - it wasn't the bitter disappointment is was almost 60 years ago. 

But then the morning was "as usual" anymore. 
Dan was watching the news when the anchorwoman, a young woman who had been with the station for about a year, suddenly froze.
 She looked about 22, the age most people got the drug, though some got it as early as 16. She was frozen in place, her eyes wide and her mouth slightly open. Staring at the paper and then the teleprompter in front of her. She finally spoke, voice shaky, "I'm sorry, we have breaking news." Last month the earliest recipients of the drug 4EvR all reported to medical centers complaining of headaches. Within 6 hours they had lost their vision and hearing. Within 24 hours they seemed to be comatose, though brain scans showed the same activity levels as a normal, conscious person. They remain in that state."

Dan stared at the screen in shock. The newscaster continued. "Scientists have been studying their condition and have come to the conclusion that it is due to the drug 4EvR." She began to cry, "And according to their findings it is not only an inevitable side effect, but also one that is triggered or transmitted to users. To summarize, all people who have ever taken 4EvR will almost certainly have been exposed to others who have been exposed to the original group and we should all expect to experience the same side effects within 2 weeks at the most." 
Dan turned off the TV.
 He was in shock. He had never taken the drug missing the age cut off by a mere two years, but all of his younger relatives had. His children, his grandchildren, so many others. Ans soon they would essentially be helpless with only a few aged people like himself to take care of them. 
Dan was suddenly filled with rage.
 It

 She looked about 22, the age most people got the drug, though some got it as early as 16. She was frozen in place, her eyes wide and her mouth slightly open. Staring at the paper and then the teleprompter in front of her. She finally spoke, voice shaky, "I'm sorry, we have breaking news." Last month the earliest recipients of the drug 4EvR all reported to medical centers complaining of headaches. Within 6 hours they had lost their vision and hearing. Within 24 hours they seemed to be comatose, though brain scans showed the same activity levels as a normal, conscious person. They remain in that state."

Dan stared at the screen in shock. The newscaster continued. "Scientists have been studying their condition and have come to the conclusion that it is due to the drug 4EvR." She began to cry, "And according to their findings it is not only an inevitable side effect, but also one that is triggered or transmitted to users. To summarize, all people who have ever taken 4EvR will almost certainly have been exposed to others who have been exposed to the original group and we should all expect to experience the same side effects within 2 weeks at the most." 
Dan turned off the TV.
 He was in shock. He had never taken the drug missing the age cut off by a mere two years, but all of his younger relatives had. His children, his grandchildren, so many others. Ans soon they would essentially be helpless with only a few aged people like himself to take care of them. 
Dan was suddenly filled with rage.
 It wasn't fair. He ha

Last month the earliest recipients of the drug 4EvR all reported to medical centers complaining of headaches. Within 6 hours they had lost their vision and hearing. Within 24 hours they seemed to be comatose, though brain scans showed the same activity levels as a normal, conscious person. They remain in that state."

Dan stared at the screen in shock. The newscaster continued. "Scientists have been studying their condition and have come to the conclusion that it is due to the drug 4EvR." She began to cry, "And according to their findings it is not only an inevitable side effect, but also one that is triggered or transmitted to users. To summarize, all people who have ever taken 4EvR will almost certainly have been exposed to others who have been exposed to the original group and we should all expect to experience the same side effects within 2 weeks at the most." 
Dan turned off the TV.
 He was in shock. He had never taken the drug missing the age cut off by a mere two years, but all of his younger relatives had. His children, his grandchildren, so many others. Ans soon they would essentially be helpless with only a few aged people like himself to take care of them. 
Dan was suddenly filled with rage.
 It wasn't fair. He had had expectation

Last month the earliest recipients of the drug 4EvR all reported to medical centers complaining of headaches. Within 6 hours they had lost their vision and hearing. Within 24 hours they seemed to be comatose, though brain scans showed the same activity levels as a normal, conscious person. They remain in that state."

Dan stared at the screen in shock. The newscaster continued. "Scientists have been studying their condition and have come to the conclusion that it is due to the drug 4EvR." She began to cry, "And according to their findings it is not only an inevitable side effect, but also one that is triggered or transmitted to users. To summarize, all people who have ever taken 4EvR will almost certainly have been exposed to others who have been exposed to the original group and we should all expect to experience the same side effects within 2 weeks at the most." 
Dan turned off the TV.
 He was in shock. He had never taken the drug missing the age cut off by a mere two years, but all of his younger relatives had. His children, his grandchildren, so many others. Ans soon they would essentially be helpless with only a few aged people like himself to take care of them. 
Dan was suddenly filled with rage.
 It wasn't fair. He had had expectations, and now everyth

 She looked about 22, the age most people got the drug, though some got it as early as 16. She was frozen in place, her eyes wide and her mouth slightly open. Staring at the paper and then the teleprompter in front of her. She finally spoke, voice shaky, "I'm sorry, we have breaking news." Last month the earliest recipients of the drug 4EvR all reported to medical centers complaining of headaches. Within 6 hours they had lost their vision and hearing. Within 24 hours they seemed to be comatose, though brain scans showed the same activity levels as a normal, conscious person. They remain in that state."

Dan stared at the screen in shock. The newscaster continued. "Scientists have been studying their condition and have come to the conclusion that it is due to the drug 4EvR." She began to cry, "And according to their findings it is not only an inevitable side effect, but also one that is triggered or transmitted to users. To summarize, all people who have ever taken 4EvR will almost certainly have been exposed to others who have been exposed to the original group and we should all expect to experience the same side effects within 2 weeks at the most." 
Dan turned off the TV.
 He was in shock. He had never taken the drug missing the age cut off by a mere two years, but all of his younger relatives had. His children, his grandchildren, so many others. Ans soon they would essentially be helpless with only a few aged people like himself to take care of them. 
Dan was suddenly filled with rage.
 It wasn't fair. He had had expectations, and now everything was upside dow

To be honest, he was beginning to be okay with the fact that he would die someday - it wasn't the bitter disappointment is was almost 60 years ago. 

But then the morning was "as usual" anymore. 
Dan was watching the news when the anchorwoman, a young woman who had been with the station for about a year, suddenly froze.
 She looked about 22, the age most people got the drug, though some got it as early as 16. She was frozen in place, her eyes wide and her mouth slightly open. Staring at the paper and then the teleprompter in front of her. She finally spoke, voice shaky, "I'm sorry, we have breaking news." Last month the earliest recipients of the drug 4EvR all reported to medical centers complaining of headaches. Within 6 hours they had lost their vision and hearing. Within 24 hours they seemed to be comatose, though brain scans showed the same activity levels as a normal, conscious person. They remain in that state."

Dan stared at the screen in shock. The newscaster continued. "Scientists have been studying their condition and have come to the conclusion that it is due to the drug 4EvR." She began to cry, "And according to their findings it is not only an inevitable side effect, but also one that is triggered or transmitted to users. To summarize, all people who have ever taken 4EvR will almost certainly have been exposed to others who have been exposed to the original group and we should all expect to experience the same side effects within 2 weeks at the most." 
Dan turned off the TV.
 He was in shock. He had never taken the drug missing the age cut off by a mere two years, but all of his younger relatives had. His children, his grandchildren, so many others. Ans soon they would essentially be helpless with only a few aged people like himself to take care of them. 
Dan was suddenly filled with rage.
 It wasn't fair. He had had expectations, and now everything was upside down. This was not his

When you're 28, science discovers a drug that stops all effects of aging, creating immortality. Your government decides to give the drug to all citizens under 26, but you and the rest of the "Lost Generations" are deemed too high-risk. When you're 85, the side effects are finally discovered.

Dan woke up early that morning, as usual, had his cup of coffee, like usual, and sat down to watch the morning news, as usual. Everything was as it always was. To be honest, he was beginning to be okay with the fact that he would die someday - it wasn't the bitter disappointment is was almost 60 years ago. 

But then the morning was "as usual" anymore. 
Dan was watching the news when the anchorwoman, a young woman who had been with the station for about a year, suddenly froze.
 She looked about 22, the age most people got the drug, though some got it as early as 16. She was frozen in place, her eyes wide and her mouth slightly open. Staring at the paper and then the teleprompter in front of her. She finally spoke, voice shaky, "I'm sorry, we have breaking news." Last month the earliest recipients of the drug 4EvR all reported to medical centers complaining of headaches. Within 6 hours they had lost their vision and hearing. Within 24 hours they seemed to be comatose, though brain scans showed the same activity levels as a normal, conscious person. They remain in that state."

Dan stared at the screen in shock. The newscaster continued. "Scientists have been studying their condition and have come to the conclusion that it is due to the drug 4EvR." She began to cry, "And according to their findings it is not only an inevitable side effect, but also one that is triggered or transmitted to users. To summarize, all people who have ever taken 4EvR will almost certainly have been exposed to others who have been exposed to the original group and we should all expect to experience the same side effects within 2 weeks at the most." 
Dan turned off the TV.
 He was in shock. He had never taken the drug missing the age cut off by a mere two years, but all of his younger relatives had. His children, his grandchildren, so many others. Ans soon they would essentially be helpless with only a few aged people like himself to take care of them. 
Dan was suddenly filled with rage.

Last month the earliest recipients of the drug 4EvR all reported to medical centers complaining of headaches. Within 6 hours they had lost their vision and hearing. Within 24 hours they seemed to be comatose, though brain scans showed the same activity levels as a normal, conscious person. They remain in that state."

Dan stared at the screen in shock. The newscaster continued. "Scientists have been studying their condition and have come to the conclusion that it is due to the drug 4EvR." She began to cry, "And according to their findings it is not only an inevitable side effect, but also one that is triggered or transmitted to users. To summarize, all people who have ever taken 4EvR will almost certainly have been exposed to others who have been exposed to the original group and we should all expect to experience the same side effects within 2 weeks at the most." 
Dan turned off the TV.
 He was in shock. He had never taken the drug missing the age cut off by a mere two years, but all of his younger relatives had. His children, his grandchildren, so many others. Ans soon they would essentially be helpless with only a few aged people like himself to take care of them. 
Dan was suddenly filled with rage.
 It wasn't fair. He had had expectations, and now everything was upside down. This was not his problem to deal with. He sat at

When you're 28, science discovers a drug that stops all effects of aging, creating immortality. Your government decides to give the drug to all citizens under 26, but you and the rest of the "Lost Generations" are deemed too high-risk. When you're 85, the side effects are finally discovered.

Dan woke up early that morning, as usual, had his cup of coffee, like usual, and sat down to watch the morning news, as usual. Everything was as it always was. To be honest, he was beginning to be okay with the fact that he would die someday - it wasn't the bitter disappointment is was almost 60 years ago. 

But then the morning was "as usual" anymore. 
Dan was watching the news when the anchorwoman, a young woman who had been with the station for about a year, suddenly froze.
 She looked about 22, the age most people got the drug, though some got it as early as 16. She was frozen in place, her eyes wide and her mouth slightly open. Staring at the paper and then the teleprompter in front of her. She finally spoke, voice shaky, "I'm sorry, we have breaking news." Last month the earliest recipients of the drug 4EvR all reported to medical centers complaining of headaches. Within 6 hours they had lost their vision and hearing. Within 24 hours they seemed to be comatose, though brain scans showed the same activity levels as a normal, conscious person. They remain in that state."

Dan stared at the screen in shock. The newscaster continued. "Scientists have been studying their condition and have come to the conclusion that it is due to the drug 4EvR." She began to cry, "And according to their findings it is not only an inevitable side effect, but also one that is triggered or transmitted to users. To summarize, all people who have ever taken 4EvR will almost certainly have been exposed to others who have been exposed to the original group and we should all expect to experience the same side effects within 2 weeks at the most." 
Dan turned off the TV.
 He was in shock. He had never taken the drug missing the age cut off by a mere two years, but all of his younger relatives had. His children, his grandchildren, so many others. Ans soon they would essentially be helpless with only a few aged people like himself to take care of them. 
Dan was suddenly filled with rage.
 It wasn't fair. He had had expectations, and now everything was upside down. This was not his problem to deal with. He sat at his desk, and sha

Dan was watching the news when the anchorwoman, a young woman who had been with the station for about a year, suddenly froze.
 She looked about 22, the age most people got the drug, though some got it as early as 16. She was frozen in place, her eyes wide and her mouth slightly open. Staring at the paper and then the teleprompter in front of her. She finally spoke, voice shaky, "I'm sorry, we have breaking news." Last month the earliest recipients of the drug 4EvR all reported to medical centers complaining of headaches. Within 6 hours they had lost their vision and hearing. Within 24 hours they seemed to be comatose, though brain scans showed the same activity levels as a normal, conscious person. They remain in that state."

Dan stared at the screen in shock. The newscaster continued. "Scientists have been studying their condition and have come to the conclusion that it is due to the drug 4EvR." She began to cry, "And according to their findings it is not only an inevitable side effect, but also one that is triggered or transmitted to users. To summarize, all people who have ever taken 4EvR will almost certainly have been exposed to others who have been exposed to the original group and we should all expect to experience the same side effects within 2 weeks at the most." 
Dan turned off the TV.
 He was in shock. He had never taken the drug missing the age cut off by a mere two years, but all of his younger relatives had. His children, his grandchildren, so many others. Ans soon they would essentially be helpless with only a few aged people like himself to take care of them. 
Dan was suddenly filled with rage.
 It wasn't fair. He had had expectations, and now everything was upside down. This was not his problem to deal with. He sat at his desk, and shaking, wrote note

Dan stared at the screen in shock. The newscaster continued. "Scientists have been studying their condition and have come to the conclusion that it is due to the drug 4EvR." She began to cry, "And according to their findings it is not only an inevitable side effect, but also one that is triggered or transmitted to users. To summarize, all people who have ever taken 4EvR will almost certainly have been exposed to others who have been exposed to the original group and we should all expect to experience the same side effects within 2 weeks at the most." 
Dan turned off the TV.
 He was in shock. He had never taken the drug missing the age cut off by a mere two years, but all of his younger relatives had. His children, his grandchildren, so many others. Ans soon they would essentially be helpless with only a few aged people like himself to take care of them. 
Dan was suddenly filled with rage.
 It wasn't fair. He had had expectations, and now everything was upside down. This was not his problem to deal with. He sat at his desk, and shaking, wrote notes to all his loved

 She looked about 22, the age most people got the drug, though some got it as early as 16. She was frozen in place, her eyes wide and her mouth slightly open. Staring at the paper and then the teleprompter in front of her. She finally spoke, voice shaky, "I'm sorry, we have breaking news." Last month the earliest recipients of the drug 4EvR all reported to medical centers complaining of headaches. Within 6 hours they had lost their vision and hearing. Within 24 hours they seemed to be comatose, though brain scans showed the same activity levels as a normal, conscious person. They remain in that state."

Dan stared at the screen in shock. The newscaster continued. "Scientists have been studying their condition and have come to the conclusion that it is due to the drug 4EvR." She began to cry, "And according to their findings it is not only an inevitable side effect, but also one that is triggered or transmitted to users. To summarize, all people who have ever taken 4EvR will almost certainly have been exposed to others who have been exposed to the original group and we should all expect to experience the same side effects within 2 weeks at the most." 
Dan turned off the TV.
 He was in shock. He had never taken the drug missing the age cut off by a mere two years, but all of his younger relatives had. His children, his grandchildren, so many others. Ans soon they would essentially be helpless with only a few aged people like himself to take care of them. 
Dan was suddenly filled with rage.
 It wasn't fair. He had had expectations, and now everything was upside down. This was not his problem to deal with. He sat at his desk, and shaking, wrote notes to all his loved ones. He wrote a note to his children, telling them how much he loved them, and how he was sorry that he couldn't be there to help them. And the

To summarize, all people who have ever taken 4EvR will almost certainly have been exposed to others who have been exposed to the original group and we should all expect to experience the same side effects within 2 weeks at the most." 
Dan turned off the TV.
 He was in shock. He had never taken the drug missing the age cut off by a mere two years, but all of his younger relatives had. His children, his grandchildren, so many others. Ans soon they would essentially be helpless with only a few aged people like himself to take care of them. 
Dan was suddenly filled with rage.
 It wasn't fair. He had had expectations, and now everything was upside down. This was not his problem to deal with. He sat at his desk, and shaking, wrote notes to all his loved ones.
